intro: Beera, commonly known as *Peganum harmala*, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of Asia and the Middle East. It belongs to the family Geraniaceae and is characterized by its small, yellowish flowers and succulent, fleshy leaves. The plant is often found growing in rocky soils and can thrive in harsh environmental conditions. Beera produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. It is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
